rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RETESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in RETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "FEV1", "FVC".
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Respiratory Test
datasetVariables.name: RETESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C111107

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RETEST

datasetVariables.label: Name of Respiratory Test
datasetVariables.name: RETEST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RESTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from REORRES in a standard format or in standard units. RESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RESTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: RESTRESC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RESTRESN

datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: RESTRESN

datasetVariables.name: REMETHOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RELOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: RELOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null. Note that REBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: REBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. Should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If REDRVFL = "Y", then REORRES could be null, with RESTRESC and (if numeric) RESTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: REDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: REEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REEVALID

datasetVariables.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: REEVALID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REREPNUM

datasetVariables.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given time frame for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of pulmonary function.
datasetVariables.label: Repetition Number
datasetVariables.name: REREPNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.name: REDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REDY

datasetVariables.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
datasetVariables.name: REDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RETPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RETPTNUM and RETPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 minutes post".
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: RETPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RETPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numeric version of RETPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: RETPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.REELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (RETPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by RETPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by RETPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: REELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RETPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by REELTM, RETPTNUM, and RETPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: RETPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable RE.RERFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RETPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RERFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the respiratory system, including the organs that are involved in breathing such as the nose, throat, larynx, trachea, bronchi and lungs. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C95098, 2018-06-29)
label: Respiratory System Findings
name: RE
